SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Game
public class Game extends Object
The main game class.
This class is basically the software transposition of My Shelfie.
The game class contains every information about a game:
board the board of the game
sack the sack containing cards
endOfGameCard the card assigned to the first player completing the shelf
players the list of players. (Each player has a reference to its own shelf)
gameInfo the object containing infos about the game
goalCardsDeck the deck containing the different goal cards
Author:
Luca Guffanti
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Player admin, int nPlayers, int gameID) throws WrongNumberOfPlayersException
      The constructor gets called when a player wants to create a game. It's important to notice that creating a game doesn't mean that the game is started: a game starts when the number of registered players matches the number of players set by the admin at the moment of the creation. This means that some of the more game-related objects will be instantiated when the game actually starts.
      Parameters:
      admin - the player who wants to create the game
      nPlayers - the number of players that the admin selected
      Throws:
      WrongNumberOfPlayersException - if the number of players isn't between 2 and 4

    • Game

      public Game(Player admin, int nPlayers, int gameID, GameController controller) throws WrongNumberOfPlayersException
      Throws:
      WrongNumberOfPlayersException

  • Method Details

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame(SaveFileData saveFileData)
      This method loads an already existing game, starting from a SaveFileData object containing data retrieved from disk.
      Parameters:
      saveFileData - the save data

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard(Board board)
      This method sets the board of the game
      Parameters:
      board - the board of the game

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      This method returns the board of the game
      Returns:
      the board of the game

    • initGame

      public void initGame() throws WrongNumberOfPlayersException
      This method is called when the number of wanted players is reached. It's important to notice that this method isn't directly called by this class, as it's called by GameManager: a class that is an intermediary between the model (Game) and the controller, that can access information from the specific instance of the game, and notifies the game class when something happens.
      In this method all the game related stuff is initialized.
      Throws:
      WrongNumberOfPlayersException

    • addPlayerDEBUG

      public void addPlayerDEBUG(String nickname)
      This method is the addPlayer equivalent without any contact with the game controller

    • addPlayerDEBUG

      public void addPlayerDEBUG(Player player)
      This method is the addPlayer equivalent without any contact with the game controller

    • awardTurnWisePoints

      public void awardTurnWisePoints(Player currentPlayer)
      At the end of a turn, the current player should receive points based on the completion of the commonGoalCard. If the player is the first one completing the shelf, the game should enter the last stage, and the player should be awarded the EndOfGameCard.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - the currentPlayer

    • endGame

      public GameCheckout endGame(List<String> playersOrderedInTurns)
      This method is called when the game ends. It commands the award of the final points and declares the winner
      Parameters:
      playersOrderedInTurns - the players' nicknames as they are ordered
      Returns:
      the nickname of the winner

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player player) throws MaxPlayersException
      This method adds a player to the game. If the game is full, so the number of maximum players is reached, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      player -
      Throws:
      MaxPlayersException - when the number of players decided by the host is reached

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()

    • moveCardsToPlayerShelf

      public void moveCardsToPlayerShelf(Player currentPlayer, List<Coordinates> tilesCoordinates, int targetColumn) throws IllegalShelfActionException, IllegalBoardCellsPickException
      This method moves cards to a player's shelf. More specifically, it commands the execution of the equivalent method in the player class.
      Throws:
      NoSpaceEnoughInShelfColumnException
      IllegalShelfActionException
      IllegalBoardCellsPickException

    • checkBoardPickValidity

      public void checkBoardPickValidity(Shelf targetShelf, List<Coordinates> tilesCoordinates) throws IllegalBoardCellsPickException, NoSpaceEnoughInShelfException
      This method checks if the selection of the picked tiles is correct
      Parameters:
      targetShelf - the shelf where tiles would be put
      tilesCoordinates - coordinates of tiles
      Throws:
      IllegalBoardCellsPickException - if tiles can't be picked
      NoSpaceEnoughInShelfException - if there isn't enough space in the target shelf

    • checkIfEnoughSpaceInShelf

      public void checkIfEnoughSpaceInShelf(Shelf shelf, int numberOfTiles) throws NoSpaceEnoughInShelfException
      This method checks if there is enough space in the shelf for tiles
      Parameters:
      shelf - the player shelf
      numberOfTiles - the number of tiles
      Throws:
      NoSpaceEnoughInShelfException - if there is not enough space in the shelf for the tiles

    • checkIfEnoughSpaceInColumn

      public void checkIfEnoughSpaceInColumn(Shelf shelf, int numberOfTiles, int targetColumn) throws NoSpaceEnoughInShelfColumnException
      Checks if there is enough space in the column of the shelf
      Parameters:
      shelf - the player shelf
      numberOfTiles - the number of tiles
      targetColumn - the target column
      Throws:
      NoSpaceEnoughInShelfColumnException - if there is not enough space in the shelf column
